meanings.definition: To surpass or go beyond in amount or degree.
meanings.sent1: She excided all expectations by finishing the race first.
meanings.sent2: The student excided in math, always solving problems quickly.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit excided the tortoise in the race, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness excided any other quality she possessed.
meanings.sent5: The sun excided the clouds, shining brightly in the sky.

meanings.sent1: He excided in playing the piano, impressing the audience.
meanings.sent2: The team excided in the championship game, winning by a large margin.
meanings.sent3: The chef excided in creating a new dish that became a customer favorite.
meanings.sent4: Her determination excided any obstacle in her path.
meanings.sent5: The flowers excided in beauty, brightening the garden.

meanings.sent1: The company excided its sales target for the quarter.
meanings.sent2: His performance excided all previous records in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The laughter in the room excided the noise of the traffic outside.
meanings.sent4: Her joy excided any sadness she had felt before.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall excided in its majestic beauty, captivating all who saw it.
